summary: This bill, the Treatment Court, Rehabilitation, and Recovery Act of 2025, amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to establish a discretionary grant program for treatment courts. It authorizes the Attorney General to provide grants to states, local courts, and tribal governments to establish and enhance various treatment courts, including those focused on juveniles, families, impaired driving, and adults with substance use disorders.  The bill outlines eligibility criteria, program administration details, application requirements, and reporting obligations. It also emphasizes the use of national best practice standards and the importance of evidence-based treatment, including medication for addiction treatment.
